answers.answer: Hi,How are you? It is said that risks for  complications during pregnancy may increase when women reach age 35. There are many factors to consider in having a healthy baby. Risks for birth defects, miscarriage, and presence of chronic health problems including diabetes and hypertension may be present that is why regular visits with your doctor is highly recommended. This link may help: http://www.webmd.com/baby/guide/pregnancy-after-35Take care and best regards.

question: i am 38 and trying to get pregnant i have 3 healthy boys 14,11, and 8, will be 39 when give birth are my chances of healthy baby good?
title: older mom healthy baby?
